lead_paragraph: BLANK--Robert Saler, died peacefully with family by his side on April 30th. A beloved husband, father, grandfather and friend, Bob had a distinguished 45 year career as a senior partner at Whitcom Partners, a company that owned and operated newspapers, magazines, TV and radio stations and cable systems. He had a special love for their newspaper holding Chesapeake Publishing. He graduated from Cornell University in 1962 and obtained his J.D. from the University of Pennsylvania. From 1965-1968 he was an Assistant U.S. Attorney in Philadelphia and Washington, DC. He spent the next three years in the Mergers and Acquisitions Department of Goldman Sachs before joining Whitcom as a partner. He was a director of Toll Brothers, Inc. and a former director of a number of publicly held corporations as well as the privately held International Herald Tribune (now the International New York Times). He was an Emeritus Trustee of the University of Pennsylvania, the Wharton School Board of Overseers, Penn Law Board of Overseers and a Trustee of Penn Medicine. He was the recipient of Penn Law's Distinguished Graduate and Alumni Achievement Award. Bob was born November 28, 1940 in Philadelphia to Ruth Saler Blank and Samuel Allen Blank. He is survived by his wife of 42 years, Nancy, his children Wendy, Samuel and Matt, son-in-law Lee, daughters-in-law Lindsay and Taryn and seven treasured grandchildren Grace, Charles, Cecily, Katherine, Eli, Lila and Noah. Bob was a man of warmth, dignity, humility and courage who will be greatly missed by all who knew him. The funeral will be held Wednesday, May 4th at 1pm at Temple Emanu-El in New York City. Contributions can be made in his memory to Memorial Sloan Kettering or New York Hospital. 1/3
